result.execSummary:
The defendant James F Espinosa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Straight time if imposed.  3 days credit if revoked.
Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior Agent approval and to be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed. Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Maintain full employment and/or combination of schooling.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. Domestic Violence Counseling.  No contact with Rebecca S. or her residence for the next 2 months and then no violent contact with Rebecca S. unless Agent modifies the condition. DNA Sample to be provided if not previously done.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment. May terminate after 9 months if deemed appropiate by Agent.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

timeConds.notes: To be performed at the rate of $10.00 per hour, to be applied to offset costs. To be performed as a condition of probation, as directed by Agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant James F Espinosa in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Bail remains as set.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

The Court schedules accordingly.  Jury status hearing scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant James F Espinosa in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Fragoso has discover and an offer.  Attorney Fragoso requests additional time for negotiations and is to let the Court know how case will proceed at next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. If City of Waukesha is able to escort defendant to his prior residence he may one time to retrieve his personal property.
